headline: Tomato, Basil, and Feta Salad
description: This Mediterranean-inspired tomato and feta salad with crunchy cucumber and fresh basil is full of flavor and a wonderful addition to any meal.
name: Tomato, Basil, and Feta Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 small cucumber - peeled, quartered lengthwise, and chopped
0.25 cup fresh basil leaves, cut into thin strips
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Toss tomatoes, cucumber, green onions, basil, feta, oil, and vinegar together in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: I made this salad and loved it. I can eat this salad all day long.. loved it.
yummy
Very good as is!
Worth a try! Easy to make with what I had from the garden, light to eat on a summer evening, and our company said it was delicious.
Perfect! I have been making a salad like this for years but never had a recipe and guessed at dressing quantity. Thanks it was delicious and now I have the measurements for the dressing.

The flavors are bomb. I made it twice once with feta and once with blue cheese as someone suggested because that’s what I had. Both were yumilicious. HOWEVER, in the future I will have the cheese on the side because the balsamic makes it look gross after just a short while. Still tasty just not as pretty as I would like. AND if you have leftovers (I made this for two people so we had a couple days to nosh through it) the cheese becomes overpowering in the salad. Other than my own pickiness, lol. I give it two thumbs up. My favorite way to eat the leftovers is over a bed of spinach. Swoon.
Fantastic easy recipe! Used cherry garden tomatoes as I had lots and it was very tasty!
This salad was delicious. Good for a hot summer's day! I had left over dressing so I used it to marinate chicken that I grilled. Will definitely make again.
I love this salad! I added arugula and would also love to add spinach in the future. everyone in my family loved it, even the one who doesn't like tomatoes or cucumber. making many more times!!
Excellent and easy recipe. I just added some mushrooms.

I made this when my son was coming over. I don’t measure. But my son says he only likes potato salad he’s not especially fond of cucumbers. When he ate it he said great potato salad mom. So I think that means it was good.
delish. my husband loved it
Omitted the onion. Light refreshing side dish. Will make again.
Delish
Made it as is, added it to my favorites!
Delicious! I peeled and seeded my cucumber and used goat cheese.
This was okay as cold summer side dish. It wasn't spectacular, just okay. And easy to put together so that gets it three stars. Probably won't repeat.
Loved this. Great flavour. I will definitely be making this again.
Yes I will make it again! No changes
perfect....just perfect.
This was easy, refreshing and beyond delicious! My clients loved it!!

I've made this salad so many times I can't even count. The only thing I'd change is instead of making the dressing, you can just go buy Kraft Greek Feta & Oregano Dressing and use that. I find that if you're not a balsamic vinegar fan then try this dressing out.
GREAT flavor! Refreshing taste! Thank you for the recipe.
Fantastic and refreshing! I will make this again & share the recipe with friends!
I made this just as written. It was a great way to use my fresh cucumber, tomato and basil. There were no leftovers!

I used grape tomatoes, basil and cucumbers from our garden and the flavor just tasted like summer! So good! Instead of feta cheese (since my hubby is not a feta fan), I used fresh mozzarella pearls and drizzled olive oil and red wine vinegar...it was a big hit at a party last night! I will make this again and again!

I am giving this five stars because it most likely deserves it. I did not make it as written, but only because I was browsing and looking for similar recipes for the ingredients that I had. I love all of the ingredients in the recipe and hope that you will enjoy and/or employ it with other ingredients.
What a great marriage of flavors! The feta cheese is wonderful in this salad, as is the fresh basil with the tomatoes. Both hubby and I agreed this was well worth making again. And again....

I made a small amount of this, but forgot the onions & Feta, and decided not to use olive oil. It was very good, but after I added Feta to the last few bites the salad tasted better. Simple and satisfying with garden-fresh basil, tomatoes, and cucumbers!
I followed the recipe exactly and it was perfect, no tweaks or substitutions needed. A real crowd pleaser... there were no leftovers, it was all devoured. I am making it again tomorrow upon request.
Fabulous! I made it last minute just to add a salad to our dinner. Even those who do not eat cucumber or tomato or feta had second helpings! Only additional thing added was fresh parsley.

I didn't care for this as much as I thought I would. I think it was the balsamic that ruined it for me. I love balsamic, but I didn't really think it went well in this. I would try this again, but using lemon juice or white vinegar instead of the balsamic.

Only change was to use dried basil and oregano instead of fresh basil - and only did that because the store didn't have fresh basil. It was really good. I'm sure it's excellent with fresh basil too. Am excited to make this again.

EASY FAST GREAT. I love this salad and eat it many to every lunch lately. I add 1/2 advocado when I can. Going to try the 
lemon juice tip from Naples today. I always have a 
pre-made hard boiled egg on side. ILoveIt.
use black olives also.
I used goat cheese instead of feta, which melted and made the dressing a bit creamy, but really delicious. I will definitely make again
I will make it again is fresh and delicious
Other then I added more feta cheese, this recipe was so good. I couldn't stop eating it.
Great fresh salad. I used cherry tomatoes cut in half and English cucumber because I like the taste better. I only used half the oil and vinegar and it was plenty.
Listen peeps, don't understand why you are seeding things and draining things, the juice from the veggies are delicious and make it even more delicious!
Nice fresh taste. I only used a small amount of the dressing mixture on then salad, then added more balsamic and lemon.
Awesome and easy!!! A great way to use fresh basil and tomatoes...I used the cherry tomatoes cut in half.
Delicious

I made this dish for my dinner party this weekend and everyone raved about how delicious and refreshing it tasted. Almost everyone asked for the recipe. It is super simple to make and taste better the longer it sits in the juices and herbs!
Excellent as-is. Didn't change a SINGLE thing! I put some chicken on top and had a fantastic lunch of the fruits of my garden.
This is good but not as special as I had hoped.
very good. I used my heirloom garden tomatoes in various colors and a regular onion since that is what I had on hand. I didn't use as much basil based on other reviews.
excellant! Used garden tomatoes,white onion and fresh mozzarella
Yum! Added some red onions. Was super yummy and filling. My fiance doesn't like feta cheese so I did not include that. Also just used balsamic vinaigrette instead of balsamic vinegar and olive oil.
Not crazy about this.
Great with a white wind vinegar and olive oil, light garlic dressing

Made this for a BBQ side dish. Tastes almost like a salsa. Really delicious. We used heirloom tomatoes and purple onion. I also increased the amount of feta. Perfect dish for a "from the garden" recipe!

This salad was excellent! The first time I try a recipe I try to follow it exactly but this time I used fresh basil because it is growing very well in my garden. The flavors melded very nicely. It's easy to make. My husband loved it also. It is a keeper.
love this salad!!

Admittedly I changed this recipe, but came up with something that we really liked. I just eyeballed the ingredients, using tomatoes, no cucumber, green onions, fresh basil, Italian salad dressing, feta and toasted almonds. The second time I made it the same way, only subbing toasted pine nuts for the almonds. I'm sure the olive oil and balsamic vinegar called for in the recipe would be wonderful as well and I may do that next time. I like this best when served at room temperature. We'll be making this a lot this summer with fresh tomatoes from the garden. UPDATE 7/12/15 -I made this again last night, but followed the recipe more closely than before. This time I layered the tomatoes and cucumbers and then sprinkled them with green onions, basil and feta. Just before serving, I drizzled it with the dressing indicated in the recipe. I did use vegetable oil instead of olive oil, as I often think EVOO is too strong and predominant in a salad dressing. This had great flavor and I will certainly do this one again. Although I do love balsamic vinegar, in a recipe like this, the dark balsamic can make the appearance of your salad rather unappealing. A possibility would be to try white balsamic vinegar.
Being in India it's hard to get Feta Cheese. I replaced it with sauteed Paneer. The result - Awesome!
Fantastic!! The basil is amazing and I loved the scallions in it - gave it such a nice flavor. We added avocado for some extra creaminess. Yum!

Made this last night for a large group of people. I did quite a bit of tweaking, though. I omitted onions all together (because I don't like onions). I lessened the ratio of oil/vinegar to the salad portion, and I added diced orange and yellow peppers. Overall turned out pretty good, even for someone who doesn't like vinegar at all.

I made this last night w/o the recipe in front of me so it only had cucumber, heritage small tomatoes halved, feta (tiny cubes), fresh basil and fresh oregano. I poured Garlic Expressions over the top and added some good Balsamic vinegar. It was by far, the best salad imaginable!!! Without the onions and olives it became a brand new taste! Both my husband and I thought it was terrific! Thanks!!

Great recipe. Wonderful flavors. I slice and salt tomatoes then allow to drain on paper towels before chopping. Mix everything, let the flavors marinate in the fridge and add the feta just prior to serving.
It's a perfect simple salad. I had it without cucumbers and it was still yummy!

This was pretty good, however I would omit the green onion next time. It was way too strong and overpowered the dish. I de-seeded the cucumber and tomatoes to make for a pretty presentation. Overall, this is a great, refreshing salad and I will make it again.

Nice side dish to my grilled pork chop tonight! 3PP per serving using only 2 Tbls of EVOO instead of 3. I used 2 medium sized tomatoes and 1 large cucumber, because that's what I had on hand. Will make again! Thanks!

I forgot to add the basil and even without it this is delicious. I made the dish the night before and that gave the flavors time to meld together. I can't wait to make this again and add the basil because I am sure that will make it even more wonderful
Superb!

This could easily become a summertime habit! Roma tomatoes have been particularly red and ripe lately in our groceries, and with a plentiful supply of basil in my garden I could eat this healthy, light, flavorful salad every day. I didn't peel the cucumbers, but to prevent excess liquid as the salad sat I seeded both the cucumbers and the tomatoes. I think with the extra green of the cucumber peel, and getting rid of that not particularly attractive "guts," that it made this salad especially pretty. The green onion provided just the slightest bit of bite, but not as much as regular onion would, which I appreciated. This really is a a more delicately flavored salad. In keeping with that, I used fresh lemon juice rather than balsamic vinegar, which I prefer when I want a lighter dressing. At the last minute I tossed in some chopped ripe avocado when I remembered I had one and it really added so much creamy contrast in texture. I loved it. And I loved this salad.

Fantastic refreshing salad that is easy and quick to prepare. We took this to our neighbor's house and the French wife and Dutch husband adored it and had thirds. I made it without the cuke as mine had gone off and threw in an extra tomato. I also only put in 2 T olive oil as I was worried about the dressing being too much without cuke. I put in some white onion as I didn't have purple or green on hand. I've gotta make this again!
A really great recipe! Very fresh and healthy. My whole family, including young kids, loved it.

Love this recipe. I use fresh Basil and Green onion from my garden. The fresh veggies make this a wonderful salad. The Basil is strong in this salad, but if you love the flavor of Basil you will enjoy this recipe as I did!
Too much olive oil, not enough vinegar. needs a little tweaking
AMAZING!!! I made this for my boyfriend and mom and all of us loved it. I made no changes to the recipe and it was perfect.

Refreshing, crisp, lots of flavor , great presentation .
Easy to prepare and will go with any dish. I did make mine way in advance so all the flavors blended. Thank you for sharing

Perfect as is. We don't change a thing unless we don't have an ingredient. Just the usual substitutions: cherry tomatoes, any kind of basil (in jar or dried). The cucumbers don't stay fresh very long, so I usually add them about 30 minutes before serving. One of our favorites.

Since I've made this recipe about 6 times this summer with our garden tomatoes, cukes and basil, I have to give it 5 starts. I've added orzo, I've added peppers, I've added kalamata olives. All awesome. I will say I use less olive oil and more cukes that it calls for.

This was pretty good - used red onion instead of scallions and upped the feta. Did not use all of the dressing - too much especially when the moisture starts coming out of the cukes and tomatoes. Quick and easy though and good for a summer side.

Very delicious! Great for hot summer days! I used a red onion in place of the green onions because it was what I had on hand. I liked the sweetness of the red onion anyway. I made this with the balsamic vinegar but think I will try it next time with some lemon juice for a lighter taste.
Don't use too much feta or it will overpower the rest of the delish flavors.

This was quick, easy and SO tasty! I had to substitute cider vinegar for balsamic, as I didn't have any but it was still really good. Will definitely make again WITH balsamic vinegar. I also chopped up a few black olives and added them for a little something extra.

Easy to prepare summer salad, I followed the recipe exactly other than adding a small amount of cold cooked Tulette pasta. The overall taste was ok, but I just thought there was a little something missing
This was great! I used small grape tomatoes instead of chopped tomatoes. This is excellent for summertime BBQs.
My hubby and friends liked this salad. I made a double batch and all most all of it went. I will make again.
Easy and refreshing. Perfect for summer.

The fresh basil was very strong, only used a little bit, and I thought the balsamic vinegar was much too strong for me.. I might use this without the basil and use red wine vinegar instead...I love all the other ingredients, vinegar was just too much :S
It was OK, I liked it but I like cukes and tomatoes...definitely very easy to make. The family was so-so about it.
So fresh and tasty!
AWESOME salad! All I added was a little minced garlic and lemon juice...excellent!
very good. next time i will add a little less vinegar and more basil
I added mozarella balls and left out the green onion. This was a big hit on Mother's Day!

Excellent. I dressed the tomatos with the vinegar first to let it soak before adding anything else.

I used baby tomatos and cut in half.
This salad was excellent!! Will definitely make it again!!
I like the flavor of the feta cheese in this salad. I'll be making this a lot this summer.
This is excellent! No changes needed at all! Doesn't keep well, so make as much as you will eat.
I enjoyed this, it had good flavor. I would make it when reday to serve, or at least wait to add the oil & vinegar as it got a bit mushy.
Wonderful salad dish suitable for a light meal for lunch or dinner.
..had leftover corn on the cob so i sliced it off and added...my daughter said it would taste even better next day but there was none left!
Meh

If you follow the recipe as written, it's very light and refreshing and perfect for those hot summer nights. I've made this several times and it's always delicious and just right when you're not in the mood to eat something heavy. Unfortunately we ate it before I thought to take a photo.

Very good. I added honey to the oil and vinegar as other reviewers mentioned and added some greens I purchased from the supermarket salad bar. I served with whole wheat salad pockets and hummus and we all stuffed our own salad pockets. I also had corn on the cob on the side and everyone (especially my husband) loved it. It was a nice change from the normal dinners I make. It was healthy, light and filling. Thank you VANCGIRL2. I will be making this again and again for sure.
This was a delicious and easy salad. I made it exactly as the recipe said - only sprinkling a little more balsamic on it as I love balsamic vinegar. Will make again this summer. Yummy.
